text.div:
Id: DT.IMMZ.D2.DT.BCG
Url: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Version: 0.2.0
Title: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Status: draft
Date: 2025-07-17 20:56:23+0000
Publisher: WHO
Description:

Determine required vaccinations
Knowledge Capability: computable
Related Artifacts:

References

  • WHO recommendations for routine immunization â€“ summary tables (March 2023) (1)
Libraries:
DTs.BCG
Actions:
Client is due for BCG vaccination: Client is due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" Neonates born to women of unknown HIV status should be vaccinated as the benefits of BCG vaccination outweigh the risks. Neonates of unknown HIV status born to HIV-infected women should be vaccinated if they have no clinical evidence suggestive of HIV infection.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for BCG vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with first BCG dose as no BCG dose was administered, client is within age range, HIV status is not positive and no live vaccine was administered. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for BCG vaccination: Client is not due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for BCG vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first BCG dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is due for BCG vaccination: Client is due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" For neonates with HIV infection confirmed by early virological testing, BCG vaccination should be delayed until ART has been started and the infant confirmed to be immunologically stable (CD4 > 25%). Moderate-to-late preterm infants (gestational age > 31 weeks) and low-birth-weight infants (< 2500 g) who are healthy and clinically stable can receive BCG vaccination at birth, or at the latest, upon discharge.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for BCG vaccination
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with first BCG dose as no BCG dose was administered, client is immunologically stable and no live vaccine was administered. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for BCG vaccination: Client is not due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for BCG vaccination

intent: (proposal)

Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance

payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as ART has not been started. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first BCG dose.)

Client is due for BCG vaccination: Client is due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" BCG vaccination is also recommended for unvaccinated older children negative for tuberculin skin test (TST) or interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA) who are in settings with high incidence of TB and/or high leprosy burden or those moving from low-to-high TB incidence/leprosy burden settings.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for BCG vaccination

status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with first BCG dose as no BCG dose was administered, client's TB test result is negative and no live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. Check for contraindications.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for BCG vaccination: Client is not due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for BCG vaccination

intent: (proposal)

Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks. Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first dose.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Clinical judgement is required. Create clinical note.: Clinical judgement is required. Create clinical note. "Immunization recommendation status" = "Further evaluation needed"
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Clinical judgement is required. Create clinical note

status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance
Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Recommend the client to perform TB infection testing. Re-evaluate client once the test result is available.)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for BCG vaccination: Client is not due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

Dynamic Values:
status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as client's TB infection test result is positive. Consider evaluating for TB disease or for TB preventive treatment (TPT) eligibility (once TB disease is ruled out).)
category.coding: (Code { system: 'http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/communication-category', code: 'alert' })
priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for BCG vaccination: Client is not due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" If children infected with HIV are receiving ART and are clinically well and immunologically stable (CD4% > 25% for children aged under 5 years), they should be vaccinated with BCG.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for BCG vaccination

Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance

Client is due for BCG vaccination: Client is due for BCG vaccination "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" BCG vaccination is also recommended for unvaccinated older children, adolescents and adults negative for TST or IGRA who are in settings with high incidence of TB and/or high leprosy burden, those moving from low-to-high TB incidence/leprosy burden settings and persons at risk of occupational exposure in low and high TB incidence areas (e.g. health workers, laboratory workers, medical students, prison workers, other individuals with occupational exposure)

action.title: Client is due for BCG vaccination
action.description:
Client is due for BCG vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"

Neonates born to women of unknown HIV status should be vaccinated as the benefits of BCG vaccination outweigh the risks. Neonates of unknown HIV status born to HIV-infected women should be vaccinated if they have no clinical evidence suggestive of HIV infection.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with first BCG dose as no BCG dose was administered, client is within age range, HIV status is not positive and no live vaccine was administered.
Check for contraindications.

action.title: Client is not due for BCG vaccination
action.description:
Client is not due for BCG vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks.
Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first BCG dose.

action.title: Client is due for BCG vaccination
action.description:
Client is due for BCG vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"

For neonates with HIV infection confirmed by early virological testing, BCG vaccination should be delayed until ART has been started and the infant confirmed to be immunologically stable (CD4 > 25%).
Moderate-to-late preterm infants (gestational age > 31 weeks) and low-birth-weight infants (< 2500 g) who are healthy and clinically stable can receive BCG vaccination at birth, or at the latest, upon discharge.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with first BCG dose as no BCG dose was administered, client is immunologically stable and no live vaccine was administered.
Check for contraindications.

action.title: Client is not due for BCG vaccination
action.description:

"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as live vaccine was administered in the last 4 weeks.
Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first BCG dose.

action.title: Client is not due for BCG vaccination
action.description:

"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

For neonates with HIV infection confirmed by early virological testing, BCG vaccination should be delayed until ART has been started and the infant confirmed to be immunologically stable (CD4 > 25%).

action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with first BCG dose as client is not immunologically stable.
Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first BCG dose.

action.title: Client is not due for BCG vaccination
action.description:
Client is not due for BCG vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due"

action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:

Check for any vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for the first BCG dose.

action.title: Client is due for BCG vaccination
action.description:
Client is due for BCG vaccination
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due"

BCG vaccination is also recommended for unvaccinated older children negative for tuberculin skin test (TST) or interferon-gamma release assay (IGRA) who are in settings with high incidence of TB and/or high leprosy burden or those moving from low-to-high TB incidence/leprosy burden settings.

action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with first BCG dose as no BCG dose was administered, client's TB test result is negative and no live vaccine was administered in the past 4 weeks.

Client is not due for BCG vaccination

If children infected with HIV are receiving ART and are clinically well and immunologically stable (CD4% > 25% for children aged under 5 years), they should be vaccinated with BCG.

BCG vaccination is also recommended for unvaccinated older children, adolescents and adults negative for TST or IGRA who are in settings with high incidence of TB and/or high leprosy burden, those moving from low-to-high TB incidence/leprosy burden settings and persons at risk of occupational exposure in low and high TB incidence areas (e.g. health workers, laboratory workers, medical students, prison workers, other individuals with occupational exposure)
